channel.title: Via the command line on Security365 Docs
channel.description: Recent content in Via the command line on Security365 Docs

item.title: Run a tunnel
item.description: Run a tunnel Before you start 1. Create a Tunnel 2. Configure the Tunnel 3. Configure routing to the Tunnel Once you have created a Tunnel and decided how to route traffic to that Tunnel, you can run the Tunnel to proxy incoming traffic from the Tunnel to any number of services running locally on your origin. To begin, run the Tunnel with the following command. The command will connect cloudflared to Cloudflare’s edge, using the configuration supplied.

item.title: Useful commands
item.description: Useful commandsNew! Set up and manage your Cloudflare Tunnel environment on the Zero Trust dashboard. You will be able to install cloudflared as a service, create and run tunnels, and get an overview of your active and inactive connectors. Refer to these instructions for a step-by-step walkthrough of the UI. Use these commands to manage local tunnels through the CLI. ​â€‹ Manage tunnels Command Description cloudflared tunnel login Prompts a browser window where you can authenticate your tunnel to your Cloudflare account.
